thread.title: TEAM NEWS: Firmino and Wijnaldum start Liverpool's tie with Wolves
thread.title_full: TEAM NEWS: Firmino and Wijnaldum start Liverpool's tie with Wolves

title: TEAM NEWS: Firmino and Wijnaldum start Liverpool's tie with Wolves
text:
0 28-Jan-2017 16:45:54 The Reds have named a heavily altered first 11 with a strong bench to call upon if needed in the fourth-round clash at Anfield on Saturday afternoon 
Jurgen Klopp has made nine changes to Liverpoolâ€™s starting XI for the FA Cup hosting of Wolves, with only Roberto Firmino and Loris Karius retained from the midweek defeat to Southampton. 
The Reds surrendered the opportunity of a Wembley date at Anfield on Wednesday, crashing out of the League Cup at the semi-final stage 2-0 on aggregate. 
Sturridge must speed past critics 
They will want to progress in this tournament, but Klopp has a balancing act in terms of selection with a decisive league game against Chelsea lying in wait on Tuesday. 
To that end, he has named a heavily altered first 11 with a strong bench to call upon if needed. 
Nathaniel Clyne is not included in the matchday squad as he nurses an abdominal issue, while Adam Lallana is not included after sustaining a cut against the Saints that needed stitches. 
Liverpool starting XI: Karius, Randall, Klavan, Gomez, Moreno, Lucas, Ejaria, Wijnaldum, Woodburn, Firmino, Origi 
Liverpool bench: Mignolet, Milner, Stewart, Can, Wilson, Coutinho, Sturridge Related
